page.title: 18HULL'S TELEPHONE SYSTEM
page.content: The visitor to Hull will immediately notice the difference in the colour of the City's telephone boxes. All other parts of the country may have red telephone boxes - in Hull they are a cream colour. The reason is that the city maintains the only privately owned telephone system in the country. Kingston upon Hull City Council administers the system. Subscribers have access to British Telecom's services and telephone network around the country and at one time the cost of telephone calls was thought to be cheaper than within the old G.P.O. system. Local phone boxes are being fitted with the most modern "push button" style telephones.
